channel.title: Commands on Useful commands compiled by bikram990
channel.description: Recent content in Commands on Useful commands compiled by bikram990

item.title: Git
item.description: Cloning and getting remote changes Clone a repository git clone <gitRepositoryURL> Clone a repository with limited history git clone --depth n <gitRepositoryURL> Infowhere n is the number of revisions you want in the history Clone specific branch git clone -b <branchName> --single-branch <gitRepositoryURL> Clone with all submodules git clone <gitRepositoryURL> --recursive Pull remote changes git pull Pull remote changes without generating a merge commit git pull --rebase Discarding changes Discard changes to a file git checkout <filePath> WarningYou will loose all the changes to that file

item.title: Openssl
item.description: Fetch certificate from a server openssl s_client -showcerts -servername <server hostname> -connect <server hostname>:443 </dev/null Example Example openssl s_client -showcerts -servername 'google.com' -connect 'google.com:443' </dev/null Create Create a Self Signed Root CA Create key pair openssl genrsa -des3 -out <key file>.key 2048 # or openssl ecparam -out <key file>.key -name prime256v1 -genkey Create CSR openssl req -new -sha256 -key <key file>.

item.title: Keytool
item.description: List List all items from a keystore keytool -list -noprompt -storepass <keystore password> -keystore <path to keystore> Example Example keytool -list -noprompt -storepass 'changeit' -keystore '/etc/pki/java/cacerts' List a particular item from a keystore keytool -list -noprompt -alias <alias of the item> -storepass <keystore password> -keystore <path to keystore> Example Example keytool -list -noprompt -alias 'globalsignrootr46' -storepass 'changeit' -keystore '/etc/pki/java/cacerts' -v Import Import a trust certificate keytool -import -trustcacerts -keystore <path to keystore> -storepass <keystore password> -noprompt -alias <alias for item> -file <certificate file> Example Example keytool -import -trustcacerts -keystore '/etc/pki/java/cacerts' -storepass 'changeit' -noprompt -alias 'mycert' -file 'cert.

item.title: SSH
item.description: Generate SSh key ssh-keygen -t <type> -C <comment> Example ssh-keygen -t ed25519 -C "john@users.noreply.github.com" # or ssh-keygen -t rsa -C "My key name" Copy my public key ssh-copy-id -i <path to key file> <user>@<hostname or ip> Example ssh-copy-id -i ~/.ssh/id_rsa john@10.10.10.1 # or ssh-copy-id -i ~/.ssh/id_rsa john@mydomainname.tld Login ssh <user>@<hostname or ip> Example ssh john@10.

item.title: Miscellaneous
item.description: Monitor ipv4 address for a hostname using macOS DNS resolver dns-sd -G v4 <hostname> Ping a host given number of times ping -c <number> <hostname> Query IP address of a hostname nslookup <hostname> Query IP address of a hostname from a specific DNS server nslookup <hostname> <dns server address> Example nslookup google.com 8.8.8.8 Query specific field from DNS server nslookup -query=<field name> <hostname> Example nslookup -query=cname google.
